Ofelia.Action: Brings a book of fairy tales despite being told it's nonsense; shows persistence in her interests
Timidly approaches her mother when she is unwell, showing concern
Carries multiple books of fairy tales despite others' disapproval, showing preparedness and intellectual curiosity.
Notifies the driver to stop the car when her mother needs help, showing awareness and timely intervention.
Moves away after acknowledging her mother's warning about her brother, indicating compliance but limited assertiveness.
Moves away from the caravan to explore the woods alone, showing curiosity but no direct interaction with others.
Fits the stone piece into the missing eye of the satyr statue, demonstrating care and attention to detail.
Smiles at the Stick Insect that emerges, showing gentle friendliness even toward a small creature.
Runs to her mother's side when called, responding to family attentiveness.
Excitedly tells her mother about the fairy she saw, showing sincere enthusiasm and openness.
Examines and fits the missing piece of the stone statue with the human eye, demonstrating curiosity, observation, and problem-solving skills.
Walks away from the main group into the woods on her own, showing independence but potentially risky behavior without apparent caution.
Exits the automobile holding her books close to her chest, showing a reserved but polite demeanor.
Extends her left hand to greet Captain Vidal, despite awkwardness and cold reception.
Runs after the Stick Insect playfully and shows curiosity about the labyrinth.
Politely thanks Mercedes after receiving her books.
Shares personal information openly with Mercedes (her deceased father, feelings about the Captain).
Corrects Mercedes firmly but not aggressively about who her father is.
Engages Mercedes with friendly small talk about her mother and her pregnancy.
Curiously investigates the labyrinth despite warnings, takes initiative to explore an unknown place.
Runs after the Stick Insect but loses it, drops her books in the process.
Firmly corrects Mercedes about her parentage, confidently asserts her own knowledge and identity.
Interacts warmly with Mercedes, asks questions about her mother, showing emotional intelligence and social awareness.
Cuddles close to her mother when cold and scared, showing trust and seeking comfort.
Gently leans on her mother's stomach and tells a calming story to soothe her baby brother.
Closes the door quietly when discovered watching attentively, showing awareness and discretion.
Cuddles close to her mother despite cold and unfamiliar surroundings, indicating emotional sensitivity but some vulnerability.
Taps gently on her mother’s stomach to communicate with unborn brother, displaying creativity and confidence in imaginative interaction.
Asks her mother why she got married, showing curiosity but possibly emotional naivety.
Hugs her mother tenderly, showing care and affection.
Wakes mother up urgently to warn her about a potential danger in the room.
Attempts to communicate gently with the Stick Insect, showing curiosity and kindness.
Gets up quietly and carefully puts on shoes to investigate a strange noise in the room, showing cautious awareness and initiative.
Uses a book illustration to communicate and clarify to the Stick Insect/Fairy what it is she sees, demonstrating resourcefulness and intelligence.
Speaks softly and carefully to the unknown creature, showing calmness and confidence in an uncertain situation.
Follows the Green Fairy into the dark, spooky labyrinth despite fear.
Speaks politely and introduces herself sincerely to the faun and fairies.
Backs away speechless and afraid upon seeing the faun's twisted, sinister figure.
Follows the Green Fairy closely through a dark, spooky labyrinth at night, demonstrating determination and courage.
Stops and looks carefully around after losing sight of the Green Fairy, instead of panicking or wandering aimlessly.
Speaks clearly and calmly ('Hello?! Echo! Echo!') in an eerie, unfamiliar environment, showing presence of mind.
Backs away speechless when confronted by a sinister faun, indicating fear or hesitation but also caution.
Touches her shoulder instinctively when prompted by the Faun, indicating attentiveness and responsiveness to new and strange information.
Attempts to open the Book of Crossroads alone and tries to understand the tasks but finds it completely blank, indicating confusion or inability to access crucial information.
Makes an effort to smile and responds positively to Carmen about the shoes, despite a weak smile.
Obeys Carmen's command to take a bath without protest.
Smiles to herself, showing hope or appreciation for being called a princess.
Accepts milk with honey from Mercedes eagerly.
Obeys orders from Carmen promptly despite feeling weak or reluctant.
Opens the magical book and observes the wondrous image appearing, paying close attention to details like the crescent moon birthmark.
Smiles weakly and does not openly defy or resist the adult figures; seems hesitant and unsure in social interactions.
Asks Mercedes if she believes in fairies and shares her own magical experience sincerely and openly.
Carefully removes her fancy dress and hair ribbon and places them hanging on tree branches before crawling into the fig tree roots.
Presses forward slowly and carefully through the claustrophobic roots and muddy environment despite discomfort from bugs crawling on her.
Stands up to the Toad, speaks boldly to it despite danger.
Shows disgust by spitting but remains calm when the Toad grabs her wrist.
Behaves resourcefully and patiently to retrieve the chestnuts and pill bug, showing composure.
Listens silently to Carmen's harsh words and expresses a faint trace of satisfaction at Captain Vidal's implied disappointment.
Greets the Green Fairy warmly and trusts it to lead her to the labyrinth.
Questions the Faun's truthfulness, showing skepticism rather than blind trust.
Takes the key and accepts the piece of chalk from the Faun, preparing for the next tasks despite uncertainty.
Questions the Faun's truthfulness, showing skepticism and critical thinking.
Leaves the well without insisting on more information about the tasks or clarifying uncertainties.
Becomes impatient while flipping through the special book and finds the pages fading to white.
Runs to get Captain Vidal urgently when her mother is bleeding badly.
Expresses doubt and sadness about never having a baby herself after hearing about her mother's condition.
Quietly observes her mother’s suffering without showing panic or anger, displaying patience and concern.
Asks Mercedes if she is helping the men in the woods, showing curiosity but no judgment.
Tells Mercedes she hasn't told anyone to protect her from harm, showing concern.
Softly embraces Mercedes, indicating trust and affection.
Expresses desire to hear Mercedes sing a lullaby despite Mercedes not remembering the words, showing patience and kindness.
Refuses the Faun's task citing her mother's sickness, showing some avoidance but potentially motivated by care.
Refuses the Faun's task explaining her mother is sick.
Shows empathy and concern by not telling anyone to protect Mercedes, indicating emotional intelligence and carefulness.
Takes the mandrake root despite feeling revolted to help her sick mother.
Takes the mandrake root from the Faun despite feeling revolted, showing willingness to follow instructions even when unpleasant.
Receives several warnings and tools (hourglass, basket with fairies) for a dangerous task, indicating she is entrusted with responsibility which suggests a level of competence.
Carefully follows instructions from the book, drawing a door and preparing to enter the magical realm while showing discipline and respect.
Picks up and puts back grapes she knocked over, except one that fell on the floor.
Sneakily eats grapes despite warnings from the Fairies.
Turns just in time to face the Pale Man and is followed by Fairies who attack to protect her.
Runs carrying the precious package with the Green Fairy following her, showing trust and care for companions.
Uses chalk to trace an outline of a door to escape danger, demonstrating resourcefulness and self-preservation but no direct warmth indicator.
Seals the trapdoor behind her, protecting herself and the Green Fairy, exhibiting responsibility for others’ safety.
Sits exhausted but calm with the Green Fairy excitedly fluttering around, showing companionship and a connection with magical friends.
Caresses her sick mother’s face gently, tending to her with care.
Preparations with the mandrake root to help her mother despite difficult circumstances.
Stays quiet and hidden when the Doctor enters, showing respect and discretion.
Carefully uses the mandrake root to help her sick mother, showing knowledge of traditional remedies and caution when the Doctor enters.
Remains hidden and silent when someone approaches, demonstrating situational awareness and discretion.
Speaks gently to her unborn brother, expressing concern for her mother and hopes for the baby’s kindness, showing vulnerability by tearing up.
Listens carefully and recognizes the seriousness of her mother's condition, showing emotional awareness and cautious behavior by staying hidden under the bed.
Approaches her mother's belly cautiously and speaks softly to her unborn brother, exhibiting sensitivity and careful communication.
Makes a promise to her unborn brother to become a Prince in her imaginary kingdom, using imagination as a coping mechanism but potentially showing avoidance of reality.
Breaks down in tears while talking to the unborn brother, indicating emotional vulnerability.
Smiles when Carmen feels better and refuses the medicine.
Gives the Faun a package and admits to breaking the rules by eating two grapes
Shows remorse and concern after realizing she has failed the task
Gives the Faun the package containing the gold dagger despite her injury, showing resolve and responsibility.
Admits she had an accident breaking the rules by letting the Fairy consume two grapes, showing lack of caution.
Attempts to justify the rule-breaking by downplaying it ('just two grapes'), showing a lack of understanding of consequences.
Crawls under the bed to retrieve the mandrake root, shows care by talking gently to it.
Defends the mandrake root and tries to explain its importance despite Vidal's aggression.
Crawls under the bed to retrieve the mandrake root despite risk of being caught.
Explains matter-of-factly that the mandrake root is a magic root given by the Faun, showing confidence in her beliefs.
Hesitates or fears as Vidal yanks her out from under the bed but does not argue or physically resist.
Hides the mandrake root under the bed, an act associated with secrecy and possibly avoiding confrontation but ultimately leads to conflict.
Hugs her mother with all her might when she is distressed.
Pleading to leave the place to protect herself and her family.
Horrified and saddened by the destruction of the root and tries to help her mother when she is in pain.
Urgently calls for help when her mother is hurting.
Listens quietly to her mother's cries and newborn baby without causing a disturbance; weeps silently at her mother's funeral.
Puts away her deceased mother's belongings carefully and respectfully.
Listens quietly and weeps silently at her mother’s funeral, showing emotional composure in a difficult moment.
Closes trunk, carefully puts away her mother’s personal items and medicines into a suitcase, demonstrating organization and responsibility.
Puts her arms around Mercedes' neck, pleading to be taken along.
Wakes up quietly to Mercedes' presence without alerting others and earnestly asks to be taken along.
Shows emotional dependence and inability to influence the situation by merely pleading to be taken, indicating limited control over events.
Steals into Vidal's study to be near the baby, tries to soothe her brother and reassure him before leaving together.
Empties sleeping medicine into Vidal's liquor, potentially to incapacitate or calm him.
Refuses to sacrifice her baby brother despite the Faun's pressure; chooses him over the promise of throne and power.
Clutches her baby brother protectively when wounded.
Reaches out for help with tears in her eyes after being shot.
Ofelia's pupils dilate as Mercedes hums a lullaby to the dying girl, showing sensitivity to others' pain.
Internal vision of Ofelia at a royal court, accepting her position quietly and reverently.
Remaining composed and fully immersed in the vision of the royal court despite her physical condition and surroundings.
Responding with a whisper to the King, indicating awareness and acceptance of the significance of the last task.
Is cheered by a hundred voices and smiles upon her return, suggesting she was friendly and well-regarded.
Finally dies with a frozen tear in her eye, indicating vulnerability and sincerity in her emotions.
